value: The Dove-Cote, A Sea-Side Turn-Out, Illustrations for Scribner's Monthly (XVIII, No. 5, September 1879, p. 649)

label: Description
value: Article clipping from Scribner's Monthly on the history on Sandy Hook. On the top left, a dove-cote with birds perched on it and flying to and fro. On the bottom, a humanoid miniature creature with antennas and wings rides a horseshoe crab being dragged by a crab.

F.S. Church in His Studio, Illustration for Harper's Weekly (XXXVII, No. 1919, September 30, 1893, p. 959)

label: Description
value: Frederick Stuart Church in his studio in front of his paintings. Church faces the viewer, holding a brush in his right hand which rests on the arm of his chair and a palate and brushes in his left. He is working on the painting to the right of the image. He wears pince-nez glasses. Below the image is an accompanying article about Church.

label: Physical description
value: Printed in black ink on paper

Illustrations for "A Wheel Around the Hub," Scribner's Monthly (XIX, No. 4, February 1880)

label: Description
value: Top; upper left, man riding bike, waving hat, down a road. Lower left, back of a centaur walking up the path, hands out in surprised. Vegetation at either side of the road. Image labeled with title, An Unexpected Meeting. Bottom; bicycle wheels, feet peddling; lower right pair of feet intertwined. Labelled and titled, Winners or Losers by Half a Length

label: Description
value: Top, article clipping from, "Around the Hub,” figures riding bikes down a road, passing children; right, school house with figure standing by doorway. Labelled and titled, Passing a School. On balcony, with tree to the left.

label: Description

In background, group of soldiers and details of Spanish architecture.
